rationale: Cambarellus patzcuarensis has been assessed as Endangered under criterion B1ab(iii). This species has an Extent of Occurrence of approximately 200 km2 and is only known from 1 - 5 locations based on ongoing water abstraction and pollution incidents. Aquatic systems in which this species is found, have been impacted by a variety of threats though the effects of these on population numbers is not known and therefore warrants further investigation. Should the population be found to be relatively stable, then this species would warrant listing under Near Threatened.
assessor: Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C.
